definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: There were still the old educational system and its attendant evils in that remote village.
sentences.chinese: 在那个遥远的小山村仍存在旧的教育体制及其流毒。

sentences.english: Even today, much effort is still needed to eliminate the pernicious influence of these absurdities spread by the Gang.
sentences.chinese: “四人帮”这些谬论的流毒，现在仍然需要大力肃清。

definition: evil elements who have escaped eradication
Rectification or Rectifying incorrect work styles, Maoist slogan/cf Rectification campaign 整風運動|整风运动, army purge of 1942-44 and anti-rightist purge of 1957
Bo Xilai (1949-), PRC politician, appointed to the Politburo in 2007, sentenced in 2013 to life imprisonment for corruption and misconduct
noxious winds, evil influences (idiom); malignant social trends
Rectification campaign/political purge/cf Mao's 1942-44 campaign at Yanan, and his 1950 and 1957 anti-rightist purges
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
